channel.title: I'm baffled

item.title: I'm baffled
item.description:
@4_2_0 wrote:

Ok. When I use the shortbow with bronze arrows the sM(“You cannot use those arrows with this bow!”); appears with every arrow. It is fine when I use the iron arrows, and if I put in dragon bolts, I get the correct sM(“You cannot use those arrows with this bow!”); - So that is good.

When it comes to the longbow, the bronze and iron arrows both work, and if I use an arrow other then those two I get the sM(“You cannot use those arrows with this bow!”); - Which is also good.

I suppose the only thing I need help with now is fixing the (shortbow and bronze arrow) it gives me the error message every time I shoot an arrow.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm baffled
item.description:
@4_2_0 wrote:

Ok.

ShortBow - Gives me the sM when I use bronze arrows, with iron arrows it’s fine, and with arrows that can’t be used such as rune bolts, it’s good.
LongBow - Good with iron and bronze, and even when I switch to rune bolts, says can’t be used, but my above method doesn’t go in effect for it, it’s the same method, but just if arrows <= 0 sM “Out of Ammo”

Sorry for the sloppy post, I hope you can understand it. I am not trying to take up your time.

Read full topic

item.title: I'm baffled
item.description:
@4_2_0 wrote:

I have been at this for hours. It’s endless. This is a snippet of the code, but here it is.

public void CheckArrowsTwo() { 	
	if (playerEquipment[playerArrows] >= 0)	{
	
	 if (playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 839 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 841 && playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 882 || playerEquipment[playerArrows] == 884) {
	    HasArrowsTwo = true;
	
	 } else { 

           HasArrowsTwo = false;
	   sM("You cannot use those arrows with this bow!");
     }
   } 
}

Ok, Now the simple point being I want you to be able to use a ShortBow & LongBow, and only be ably to use those two Arrows. FOR SOME REASON. It only allows the ShortBow which is 841 to send the message if the arrow isn’t acceptable. Not the long bow. Aghhh. I’ve searched up and down the client.java and every other file for that matter. Any ideas?

Read full topic
